This should ensure  that the following stylesheet processing instruction is honored by  these new browser versions. For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Medical Physiology and Therapeutics</title>   <subtitle>A new and innovative course, the Medical Physiology and Therapeutics degree is designed to provide graduate-level employees for the healthcare science sectors. We offer high-quality teaching and research in a stimulating learning environment and facilities that are based in a purpose-built medical school on the new Royal Derby Hospital site.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T01:23:31Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Medical Physiology and Therapeutics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medical-physiology-and-therapeutics-bsc.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rosie Sherwin</name>     </author>     <summary>The course aims to produce graduates who could enter a number of disciplines within the NHS or with a wide range of employers. Potential career pathways include employment in the areas of haematology, immunology, genetics, microbiology, embryology and many more.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:01:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-07-31T10:35:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medical-physiology-and-therapeutics-bsc.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Medical Physiology and Therapeutics with a Foundation Year BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medical-physiology-and-therapeutics-with-a-foundation-year-bsc.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Rosie Sherwin</name>     </author>     <summary>The four-year BSc Medical Physiology and Therapeutics with a Foundation Year has been designed to widen access to higher education to meet the needs of the NHS and other employers for graduate-level employees in a number of healthcare science disciplines.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:01:00Z</published>     <updated>2014-07-21T14:40:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/medicalphysiologyandtherapeutics/medical-physiology-and-therapeutics-with-a-foundation-year-bsc.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
